// Questionnaire 1 strings STR DEX CON INT WIS CHA Choose Your Character\'s Name Next Questionnaire When creating a character in the world of Dungeons and Dragons, the first questions you should ask yourself is what you want your character\'s race, class, and alignment to be. These questions will determine many things such as certain stat bonuses, starting equipment, hit die, and more! The two most common ways to choose your stat values are as follows: Option 1 is to roll 4d6, drop the lowest number, then record the total. Do this 6 times for 6 totals and choose which number to put for each stat. Option 2 is to use the numbers 15, 14, 13, 12, 10, and 8 on whichever stat you choose. The numbers MUST be between 3 and 18. Consult your DM for more options.

//Barbarian leveling up/subclass bonuses Primal Path: Rage: As a bonus action, you can enter a rage. While raging and not wearing heavy armor, you have advantage on STR checks and saving throws, you deal bonus damage(listed above) on all STR-based melee attacks, and you have resistance to bludgeoning, piercing and slashing damage. The rage lasts for 1 minute or can end early if you end your turn without having dealt or taken damage since your previous turn, if you are knocked unconscious, or if you choose to end it as a bonus action. Rage Uses: Rage Damage: Reckless Attack: When you make a melee attack, you may choose to make it reckless, giving you advantage on any attack rolls this turn, but until the start of your next turn, attacks against you have advantage Danger Sense: You have advantage on Dexterity saving throws against effects you can see such as traps and spells, provided you are not blinded, deafened, or incapacitated Extra Attack: When you take the attack action on your turn, you may attack twice Feral Instinct: You have advantage on Initiative rolls Brutal Critical: When you score a critical hit with a melee attack, you can roll ONE more of your weapon\'s damage die Relentless Rage: While raging, if you drop to 0HP you can make a DC10 CON saving throw. On a success, you drop to 1HP instead. The DC increases by 5 every time you use this feature until you take a long rest. Relentless Rage DC: Persistent Rage: Your rage only ends early if you fall unconscious or if you choose to end it. Indomitable Might: If your total for a STR check is less than your STR score, you can use that score instead. Primal Champion: Your Strength and Constitution scores have both increased by 4. Frenzy: When you rage, you can go into a frenzied rage. While frenzied, you can you can make 1 melee weapon attack as a bonus action on each of your turns. When your rage ends, you suffer 1 point of exhaustion Mindless Rage: You cannot be charmed or frightened while raging. If you are charmed or frightened before you rage, the effect is suspended until you finish raging. Intimidating Presence: As an action, you can frighten a creature within 30ft of you, if they can hear you. They must succeed a WIS saving throw (DC = 8 + your proficiency bonus + your CHA modifier) or be frightened by you until the end of your next turn. You can use an action on each of your turns to extend the duration. This effect ends if you lose line of sight to the creature or it moves 60ft away from you. Retaliation: When you take damage from a creature within 5ft of you, you can use your reaction to make a melee weapon attack against that creature. Spirit Seeker: You can cast the spells "beast sense" and "speak with animals" as rituals. You gain a magical benefit based on the totem animal of your choice. It can be the same or different than the totem animal you initially chose. Totem Spirit: Bear: While raging, you have resistance to all damage except psychic damage. Totem Spirit: Eagle: While raging, other creatures have disadvantage on opportunity attacks against you. You can also Dash as a bonus action Totem Spirit: Wolf: While raging, Your friends have advantage on melee attack rolls against creatures within 5ft of you that are hostile to you. Totem Spirit: Tiger: While raging, you add 10ft to your long jump and 3ft to your high jump. Aspect of the Bear: Your carrying capacity is doubled and you have advantage on STR checks to push, pull, lift, or break objects. Aspect of the Eagle: You can see up to 1 mile away with no difficulty and are able to discern fine details at something no more than 100ft away. Dim light no longer imposes disadvantage on Perception checks. Aspect of the Wolf: You can track other creatures while traveling at a fast pace, and can move stealthily at a normal pace. Aspect of the Tiger: You gain proficiency in 2 of the following skills: Athletics, Acrobatics, Stealth, or Survival. Spirit Walker: You can now cast the spell "Commune with Nature" as a ritual. When you do, a spiritual version of one of the animals you chose for a totem spirit appears to assist you. Totemic Attunement: Bear: While raging, any creature within 5ft of you that is hostile to you has disadvantage on attack rolls against creatures that are not you. An enemy is immune to this effect if they cannot be frightened or cannot see or hear you. Totemic Attunement: Eagle: While raging, you have a flying speed equal to your walking speed, but it only works in short bursts. If you end your turn in the air, you begin to fall. Totemic Attunement: Wolf: While raging, you can use a bonus action to knock a Large or smaller creature prone when you hit it with a melee weapon attack. Totemic Attunement: Tiger: While raging, if you move 20ft toward a large or smaller creature right before making a melee attack against it, you can make 1 more melee attack against it as a bonus action.
//Bard leveling up/subclass bonuses Bard College: Bardic Inspiration: As a bonus action, choose another creature within 60ft of you to inspire. Within the next 10 minutes, that creature can add your Bardic Inspiration die to one ability check, attack roll, or saving throw they make Bardic Inspiration Die: Bardic Inspiration Uses: Song of Rest: If you or allies take a short rest and heal using one or more of their hit dice, they regain extra HP based on your Song of Rest die below Song of Rest Die: Jack of All Trades: Any skill check you make that doesn\'t already add your proficiency bonus, you can now add half your proficiency bonus (rounded down) Font of Inspiration: You regain all uses of Bardic Inspiration after a short or long rest Countercharm: As an action, you can start a performance that will last until the end of your next turn. During that time, you and any friendly creatures within 30ft of you have advantage on saving throws against being frightened or charmed Magical Secrets: You gain access to 2 spells from any other character class list. You may add them from the spellcasting tab. Superior Inspiration: When you roll initiative and have no uses of Bardic Inspiration left, you regain one use Cutting Words: When a creature within 60ft of you makes an attack roll, ability check, or damage roll, you can use your reaction to roll one of your Bardic Inspiration die and subtracting the number from the creatures roll. The creature is immune if it cannot hear you or is immune to being charmed. Peerless Skill: When you make an ability check, you can expend one use of your Bardic Inspiration on yourself. Combat Inspiration: A creature that has a Bardic Inspiration die from you can roll it and add to a damage roll they make. They can also use their reaction after being attacked to add the Bardic Inspiration die roll to their AC for that attack. Battle Magic: When you use your action to cast a Bard spell, you may make 1 weapon attack as a bonus action.
//Cleric leveling up/subclass bonuses Channel Divinity: You gain the ability to channel divine energy from your deity and use it to produce magical effects. This can be used a number of times per long rest as shown above. Channel Divinity Uses: Channel Divinity Abilities: Channel Divinity: Turn Undead: As an action, you present your holy symbol and speak a prayer. Each undead within 30ft must succeed at a wisdom saving throw or, for 1 minute, spend its turns moving as far away from you as possible. They can only use their action to dash or dodge, if they cannot move further form you. Channel Divinity: Knowledge of the Ages: As an action, you can give yourself proficiency in one tool or skill of your choice for 10 minutes Channel Divinity: Read Thoughts: Choose one creature within 60ft of you. If that creature fails a WIS saving throw, you can read it\'s surface thoughts for 1 minute while within range. You may end this effect and cast the suggestion spell on it without expending a spell slot and with a guaranteed failure on it\'s saving throw. Channel Divinity: Preserve Life: You evoke healing energy that gives an amount of HP equal to 5 times your level that you can divide out amongst any creatures within 30ft of you. This has no effect on undead or constructs and can heal a creature up to no more than half their HP maximum Channel Divinity: Radiance of the Dawn: Magical Darkness within 30ft of you is dispelled and each hostile creature within 30ft must make a CON saving throw. They take radiant damage equal to 2d10 + your level on a failed save or half as much on a successful one. Channel Divinity: Charm Animals and Plants: As an action, you present your holy symbol and each beast or plant creature within 30ft of you must make a WIS saving throw or be charmed by you for 1 minute. Channel Divinity: Destructive Wrath: When you roll for lightning or thunder damage, you can instead use your Channel Divinity to deal maximum damage instead. Channel Divinity: Invoke Duplicity: As an action, you can create a perfect illusion of yourself that lasts for 1 minute. You can cast spells through the illusion as though you are there, and if both you and the illusion are within 5ft of a creature, you have advantage on attack rolls against the creature. As a bonus action, you may move the duplicate up to 30ft to a location you can see, but it must remain within 120ft of you. Channel Divinity: Cloak of Shadows: As an action, you become invisible until the end of your next turn, or until you attack or cast a spell. Channel Divinity: Guided Strike: When you make an attack roll, you may gain a +10 bonus to the roll. Channel Divinity: War God\'s Blessing: When a creature within 30ft of you makes an attack roll, you may use your reaction to grant a +10 bonus to the attack roll. Destroy Undead: If an undead fails the saving throw against Turn Undead and has a CR less than or equal to a certain threshold, it is immediately destroyed Destroy Undead Threshold: Divine Intervention: Divine Intervention: As an action, you can call on your Deity for aid. Describe the assistance you require, then roll a percentile die. If you roll less than or equal to your level, your deity will come to your aid. If it succeeds, you cannot use this ability for another 7 days. If it fails, you may attempt it again after a long rest Divine Intervention Success Range: Potent Spellcasting: You now add your WIS modifier to the damage you deal with any Cleric cantrip Vision of the Past: You can spend 1 minute meditating/praying on an object or your surroundings and receive visions of recent events regarding the object\'s previous owners or the area\'s previous events Visions of the Past: Disciple of Life: When you cast a spell to restore HP to a creature, that creature regains additional HP equal to 2 + the spell\'s level Blessed Healer: When you cast a spell to restore HP to another creature, you also regain HP equal to 2 + the spell\'s level Divine Strike: Once per turn, when you hit an enemy with a melee weapon attack, you can cause it to deal an extra 1d8 damage. The damage type is Improved Divine Strike: Your Divine Strike now deals 2d8 extra damage. Supreme Healing: When you cast a spell to heal a creature, instead of rolling the dice, you would heal the maximum amount possible. Warding Flare: When you are attacked by a creature within 30ft of you, you can use your reaction to impose disadvantage on the attack roll by flashing a blinding light between you and the attacker. This does not work if the attacker cannot be blinded Warding Flare: Improved Flare: You can use your Warding Flare when a creature within 30ft of you is attacking someone other than you. Corona of Light: You can use your action to activate an aura of sunlight that emits bright light within a 60ft radius of you. Enemies within that range have disadvantage on saving throws against any spell that deals fire or radiant damage. Dampen Elements: When you or a creature within 30ft of you takes acid, cold, fire, lightning, or thunder damage, you can use your reaction to halve the damage. Master of Nature: When a beast or plant creature is charmed by your Charm Animals and Plants feature, you can take a bonus action to command them what to do on their next turn. Wrath of the Storm: When a creature within 5ft of you hits you with an attack, you can use your reaction to force the creature to make a DEX saving throw. They take 2d8 Lightning or Thunder damage on a failed save or half as much on a successful one. Wrath of the Storm: Thunderbolt Strike: When you deal Lightning or Thunder damage to a Large or smaller creature, you also push it up to 10ft away from you. Stormborn: When you are not underground or indoors, you have a flying speed equal to your current walking speed. Blessing of the Trickster: As an action, you can touch another willing creature and give them advantage on Stealth checks for 1 hour or until you use it on a different creature. Improved Duplicity: When you use your Invoke Duplicity feature, you now make up to 4 duplicates instead of 1. You can use a bonus action on your turn to move any number of them up to 30ft. War Priest: When you take the attack action, you may make 1 weapon attack as a bonus action on your turn. War Priest: Avatar of Battle: You now have resistance to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage from nonmagical attacks.
//Druid leveling up/subclass bonuses Druid Circle: Wild Shape: As an action, you can magically transform into a beast within certain parameters. You can revert early if you choose. Your statistics are replaced by the beast\'s statistics, but you retain your alignment, personality, and your INT, WIS, and CHA scores. You cannot speak or cast spells when in beast form. Wild Shape Uses: Wild Shape Time Limit: Wild Shape Limits: Timeless Body: Due to druidic magic forces, your body only ages 1 year for every 10 years that pass. Beast Spells: You can now perform the Somatic and Verbal aspects of a spell while in beast form, but cannot provide material components. Archdruid: You can now use your Wild Shape an unlimited amount of times. Natural Recovery: Once per day, when you finish a short rest, you can regain spell slots that have a combined level of half your level. These slots cannot be 6th level or above. Natural Recovery Amount: Natures Ward: You are immune to poison and disease and can no longer be frightened or charmed by fey or elementals Nature\'s Sanctuary: When a beast or plant creature attacks you, it must succeed on a WIS saving throw. If it fails, it must either choose a new target or automatically miss the attack. The attacker is aware of this effect before it attacks. Combat Wild Shape: You can now use your wild shape feature as a bonus action. Also, while transformed by wild shape, you can use a bonus action to expend a spell slot and heal 1d8 for each level of the spell slot expended Circle Forms: You can now transform into a beast with a challenge rating as high as one third your level rounded down. Primal Strike: Your attacks in wild shape now count as magical for the purposes of overcoming resistance and immunity to nonmagical attacks Elemental Wild Shape: You can expend two uses of your wild shape to transform into a water, earth, fire, or air elemental Thousand Forms: You can now cast the Alter Self spell at will.
//Fighter leveling up/subclass bonuses Martial Archetype: Fighting Style: Second Wind: As a bonus action, you can heal yourself. You can do this once per long rest. "Second Wind amount: " Action Surge: You may use this ability to take an additional action on your turn. You must take a long rest before you can use this ability again Action Surge Uses: Indomitable: You can use this ability to re-roll a failed saving throw. You must use the new roll. You must take a long rest before you can use this ability again Indomitable Uses: Extra Attack: When you take the attack action on your turn, you may attack three times Extra Attack: When you take the attack action on your turn, you may attack four times Improved Critical: Your weapon attacks can now score a critical hit on a dice roll of 19 and 20 Remarkable Athlete: You can add half your proficiency bonus to any Strength, Dexterity, or Constitution check you make that doesn\'t already include your proficiency bonus. In addition, When you make a running long jump, the distance you can cover increases by a number of feet equal to your STR modifier Superior Critical:Your weapon attacks now score a critical hit on a dice roll of 18â€“20 Survivor: If you are at half your HP or less (but not at 0) at the start of your turn, your regain HP equal to 5 + your CON modifier Weapon Bond: You can perform a 1 hour ritual during a short rest with a weapon that becomes bonded to you. You can have 2 weapons bonded to you at once. You cannot be disarmed of a bonded weapon unless you are incapacitated. If it is on the same plane of existence, you can teleport your bonded weapon to you as a bonus action War Magic: When you use your action to cast a cantrip, you can make 1 weapon attack as a bonus action. Eldritch Strike: When you hit a creature with a weapon attack, that creature has disadvantage on the next saving throw it makes against a spell you cast before the end of your next turn. Arcane Charge: When you use an action surge, you can teleport up to 30ft away to an unoccupied space you can see either before or after the action surge Improved War Magic: When you use your action to cast a spell, you can make one weapon attack as a bonus action
//Monk leveling up/subclass bonuses Monastic Tradition: Martial Arts: While you are not wearing armor, and unarmed or wielding only monk weapons (Shortswords or any simple weapon that isn\'t two-handed or heavy), you can use your DEX modifier instead of STR for attack and damage rolls with unarmed strikes and monk weapons, your unarmed strikes deal more damage(listed above), and when you take the attack action, you can make 1 unarmed strike as a bonus action. Unarmed Strike Damage: Unarmored Movement: If you are not wearing armor or wielding a shield, your speed increases Unarmored Movement: You now have access to an amount of Ki points equal to your level which have various uses Ki points: Ki Point Abilities: Flurry Of Blows: You can spend 1 Ki point to make 2 unarmed strikes as a bonus action, immediately after taking the attack action Patient Defense: You can spend 1 Ki point to take the Dodge action on your turn as a bonus action Step Of The Wind: You can spend 1 Ki point to take the Disengage or Dash action as a bonus action, and your jump distance is doubled for the turn Stunning Strike: You may spend 1 Ki point when you hit an enemy with a melee attack to attempt to stun them. They must succeed at a constitution saving throw or be stunned until the end of your next turn Deflect Missiles: If you use your Deflect Missiles ability and reduce the damage to 0, you can spend 1 Ki point and, as part of the same reaction, make a ranged attack with that weapon, using your proficiency bonus. Diamond Soul: If you fail a saving throw, you can spend 1 Ki point to re-roll it. You must take the second result. Empty Body: As an action, you can spend 4 Ki points to become invisible for 1 minute. During this time, you are resistant to all damage except force damage Empty Body: You can spend 8 Ki points to cast Astral Projection without needing material components. You cannot take anyone with you. Slow Fall: you can use your reaction when you fall to reduce your falling damage by 5 times your Monk level Deflect Missiles: If you are hit by a ranged attack, you can use your reaction to deflect or catch it. Doing this, will reduce the damage by 1d10 + your DEX modifier + your Monk level. Ki-Empowered Strikes: Your unarmed strikes now count as magical for the purpose of overcoming resistance to non-magical attacks and damage Evasion: When making a DEX saving throw that allows you to take half damage on a success, you instead take no damage on a success and half damage on a failure Stillness Of Mind: As an action, you can end one effect on yourself that is causing you to be frightened or charmed. Purity Of Body: You are now immune to disease and poison Tongue Of The Sun And Moon: You can now understand any spoken language and any creature that understands a language can understand what you say. Diamond Soul: You have proficiency in all saving throws Timeless Body: Your Ki sustains you and you no longer need food or water and suffer none of the frailty of old age. You cannot be aged magically, but you can still die of old age. When you roll for initiative and have no Ki points remaining, you regain 4 Ki points. Open Hand Technique: When you hit a creature with your Flurry of Blows, you can impose one of the following effects on the opponent: They must succeed on a DEX saving throw or be knocked prone. They must succeed on a STR saving throw or be pushed up to 15ft away form you. They cannot take reactions until the end of your next turn. Wholeness of Body: Once per long rest, as an action, you can heal yourself HP equal to 3 times your level. Wholeness of Body: Tranquility: After a Long Rest, you gain the effect of a Sanctuary spell that lasts until the start of your next long rest. The DC is 8 + your WIS modifier + your proficiency bonus Quivering Palm: When you hit a creature with an unarmed strike, you can spend 3 ki points to start imperceptible vibrations which last for a number of days equal to your level.The vibrations are harmless unless you use your action to end them if you are on the same plane of existence. When you end them in this way, the creature must make a CON saving throw or be reduced to 0 HP. On a successful save, they take 10d10 Necrotic damage. You can only have 1 creature under the effects at one time and can also end the vibrations harmlessly. Shadow Arts: You can spend 2 Ki points to cast Darkness, Pass Without Trace, or Silence without providing material components. You also know the Minor Illusion cantrip. Shadow Step: While in dim light or darkness, you can use a bonus action to teleport up to 60ft to an unoccupied space in dim light or darkness. You then have advantage on the first melee attack you make before the end of your turn. Cloak of Shadows: While in dim light or darkness, you can use an action to become invisible, remaining invisible until you attack, cast a spell, or enter an area of bright light. Opportunist: When a creature within 5ft of you is hit by an attack made by a creature other than you, you can use your reaction to make a melee attack against that creature.
//Paladin leveling up/subclass bonuses Sacred Oath: Divine Sense: As an action, you can detect the location of any Celestial, Fiend, or Undead within 60 ft of you. You can use this ability a number of times equal to 1 + you CHA modifier Divine Sense Uses: Lay On Hands: You have a healing pool equal to 5*your Paladin Level. As an action, you can touch a creature and expend 5 points to heal a disease or poison affecting them, or heal them for up to as many points as you have left in the pool. This healing pool will refill after a long rest Lay On Hands pool: Divine Smite: When you hit a creature with a melee attack, you can expend a Spell Slot to deal an extra 2d8 radiant damage to it for a level 1 spell slot, and an extra d8 for every spell slot above first level, for a maximum of 5d8. The damage is increased by an extra d8 if the creature is undead. Divine Health: You are now immune to disease Aura Of Protection: Whenever you or a friendly creature within 10ft of you must make a saving throw, they gain a bonus equal to your CHA modifier, if you are conscious. Aura Of Courage: You and friendly creatures within 10ft of you cannot be frightened. Improved Divine Smite: All of your melee weapon attacks deal an extra 1d8 radiant damage Cleansing Touch: As an action, you can end one spell effect on yourself or a creature that you touch. You may use this a number of times equal to your CHA modifier. expended uses are regained after a long rest Cleansing Touch Uses: Channel Divinity: Your Paladin Oath allows you to channel divine energy to fuel magical effects. This ability can only be used once per short/long rest. Channel Divinity: Sacred Weapon: As an action, you can imbue one weapon that you are holding with positive energy. For 1 minute, you add your CHA modifier (minimum of +1) to attack rolls made with that weapon. That weapon also sheds bright light in a 20-foot radius and dim light 20 feet beyond that. The weapon is also considered magical for the duration. The effect ends if you end it as part of an action, if you are no longer holding/carrying it, or if you fall unconscious. Turn the Unholy: As an action, you present your holy symbol and speak a prayer. Each Fiend or Undead creature that can see or hear you within 30 feet must make a WIS saving throw or be turned for 1 minute or until it takes damage. A turned creature must spend its turns trying to get as far away from you as it can, and cannot willingly move to a space within 30 feet of you, and cannot take reactions. It\'s only action can be the dash action or to try and escape from an effect that prevents it from moving. If there is nowhere to go, it takes the dodge action. Nature\'s Wrath: As an action, you cause spectral vines to spring up and reach for a creature within 10 feet of you that you can see. The creature must make a STR or DEX saving throw (their choice) or be restrained. While restrained, the creature repeats the saving throw at the end of each of its turns. On a success, it frees itself and the vines vanish. Turn the Faithless: As an action, you present your holy symbol and speak a prayer. Each Fiend or Fey creature that can see or hear you within 30 feet must make a WIS saving throw or be turned for 1 minute or until it takes damage. A turned creature must spend its turns trying to get as far away from you as it can, and cannot willingly move to a space within 30 feet of you, and cannot take reactions. It\'s only action can be the dash action or to try and escape from an effect that prevents it from moving. If there is nowhere to go, it takes the dodge action. If the creature is concealed by an illusion, shapeshifting, or other effect, that form is revealed while it is turned. Abjure Enemy: As an action you present your holy symbol and speak a prayer. Choose one creature you can see within 60 feet. That creature must make a WIS saving throw (unless they are immune to being frightened)(Fiends and Undead have disadvantage) or be frightened for 1 minute or until they take damage. While frightened, the creature\'s speed turns to 0 and they cannot benefit from any bonus to their speed. On a successful save, the creature\'s speed is halved for 1 minute or until it takes damage. Overchannel: When you cast a spell of level 1 through 5 that deals damage, you can deal maximum damage with that spell. The first time you do so before taking a long rest, you suffer no penalty. Using this feature again before taking a long rest will make you suffer 2d12 necrotic damage for each level of the spell immediately after you cast it. This damage increases by 1d12 per spell level every subsequent time you use this feature before your next long rest.This damage ignores damage resistance and immunity. Illusion Savant: The gold and time you must spend to copy an Illusion spell into your spellbook is halved Improved Minor Illusion: When you cast Minor Illusion, you can create a sound and an image with 1 casting of it. Malleable Illusions: When you cast an Illusion spell that has a duration of 1 minute or longer, you can use your action to change the nature of the illusion if you can still see it. Illusory Self: When a creature makes an attack roll against you, you can use your reaction to interpose an illusory duplicate between you and the attacker. The attack automatically misses and the illusion dissipates. This can be done once per short or long rest Illusory Self: Illusory Reality: When you cast an Illusion spell of 1st level or higher, You can choose one inanimate nonmagical part of the illusion and make it real. This can be done as a bonus action on your turn when the spell is ongoing. The object remains real for 1 minute, but cannot deal damage or directly harm anyone. Necromancy Savant: The gold and time you must spend to copy a Necromancy spell into your spellbook is halved Grim Harvest: When you kill a creature with a spell of 1st level or higher, you regain HP equal to twice the spell\'s level, or three times if the spell is a Necromancy spell. This effect does not work on undead or constructs. Undead Thralls: When you cast Animate Dead, you can target 1 additional corpse or pile of bones. Additionally, when creating an undead using a Necromancy spell increases their HP maximum by an amount equal to your level and they add your proficiency bonus to their attack rolls. Inured to Undeath: You have resistance to Necrotic damage and your HP maximum cannot be reduced. Command Undead: As an action, you can choose 1 undead you can see within 60ft of you to make a CHA saving throw against your spell save DC. If the target succeeds, you cannot use this feature on it again. On a failure, it becomes friendly to you and obeys your commands. If the target has an INT of 8 or higher, it has advantage on the saving throw. If it has an INT of 12 or higher and fails the save, it can repeat the saving throw at the end of every hour until it succeeds. Transmutation Savant: The gold and time you must spend to copy a Transmutation spell into your spellbook is halved Minor Alchemy: You can spend time focusing on one nonmagical object changing it from one substance to another. For each ten minutes you focus on an object made entirely of either wood, stone, iron, copper, or silver, you can change 1 cubic foot of that material to another type listed. After 1 hour or until you lose concentration, the material reverts back to it\'s original form. Transmuter\'s Stone: You can spend 8 hours creating a transmuter\'s stone that stores transmutation magic. As long as a creature, yourself included,is holding the stone, it gains a benefit of your choice when you create the stone. Choose one of the following options when you create the stone: 60 feet of Darkvision, +10ft movement speed, proficiency in Constitution saving throws, resistance to either Acid, Cold, Fire, Lightning, or Thunder damage. If you create another stone, the previous one stops working. Each time you cast a Transmutation spell of level 1 or higher, you can change the effect of the stone if it is on your person. Shapechanger: Once per short rest, you can cast Polymorph without expending a spell slot, but only on yourself and you are restricted to a beast with a CR of 1 or lower. You may still cast Polymorph normally using a spell slot. Shapechanger: Master Transmuter: You can use your action to consume the reserve of magic within your transmuter stone in a single burst, destroying the stone. Choose one of the following effects to happen: You can spend 10 minutes to transmute a nonmagical object no larger than 5 cubic feet into another nonmagical object of similar size and mass. You can restore all HP and remove all curses, diseases, and poisons affecting a creature you touch with the stone. You can cast Raise Dead without expending a spell slot. Or you can touch a willing creature with the stone and reduce their apparent age by 3d10 (minimum 13) years. This does not extend their lifespan.
